bill_title: provide a procedure for awarding construction project contracts if no bids are received during a competitive bid process and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a procedure for awarding construction project contracts if no bids are received during a competitive bid process. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 5-18-9.1 be amended to read as follows: 5-18-9.1. If after advertising for bids pursuant to § 5-18-3 for any construction project or the purchase of materials, supplies, or equipment, no bids are received, the governing board of a unit of local government may negotiate a contract for any construction project or the purchase of the materials, supplies, or equipment at the most advantageous price. However, the construction project, materials, supplies, or equipment shall meet the specifications of the original advertisement for bids. The governing board shall contact and attempt to obtain competitive quotations from at least three suppliers businesses . A record of the names of the suppliers businesses , the quotations received and the procurement procedures used in purchasing shall be documented, spread upon included in the minutes, and retained on file by the governing body. The contract may include a procedure for adjusting prices to meet changing market conditions not within the control of the vendor business . The adjustments may not result in increases in the profit of the vendor business , and shall be supported by written justification filed with the purchasing agent of the unit of local government.
